documentation.text:
This contract manages the Oracle and CoinPair registration info.
 The Oracle python server interacts with this contract:
 - Coin pair registration
 - Oracle registration to coin pairs
 - Access Oracle info (oracle address + url) indexed by oracle owner address
 - Get the oracle information (url + the specifics of some coin pair rounds) from an oracle address
 - Get the oracle address from the owner address.

@notice Subscribe a registered oracle to participate in the next round of a registered coin-pair.
 @param oracleOwnerAddr Address of oracle owner

@notice Returns true if oracle is registered.
 @param ownerAddr The address of the oracle's owner.

@notice Used by CoinPair
 @param oracleAddr The oracle address not the owner address.
@notice Returns the amount of owners registered.

@notice Returns the oracle name and address at index.
 @param idx index to query.
@notice Returns true if an oracle is subscribed to a coin pair

@notice Return true if the oracle is registered on this coin-pair
 @param oracleAddr addr The address of the Oracle check for.

@notice Returns registration information for a registered Oracle.
 @param oracleAddr addr The address of the Oracle to query for.

@notice Returns true if an oracle satisfies conditions to be removed from system.
 @param oracleAddr the oracle address to lookup.

@notice Get the stake in MOCs that an oracle has.
 @param oracleAddr The address of the oracle.

@notice Returns the count of registered coin pairs.
 Keep in mind that Deleted coin-pairs will contain zeroed addresses.

@notice Returns the coin pair at index.
 @param i index to query.

This contract manages the Oracle and CoinPair registration info.
 The Oracle python server interacts with this contract:
 - Coin pair registration
 - Oracle registration to coin pairs
 - Access Oracle info (oracle address + url) indexed by oracle owner address
 - Get the oracle information (url + the specifics of some coin pair rounds) from an oracle address
 - Get the oracle address from the owner address.

@notice Subscribe a registered oracle to participate in the next round of a registered coin-pair.
 @param oracleOwnerAddr Address of oracle owner

@notice Returns true if oracle is registered.
 @param ownerAddr The address of the oracle's owner.

@notice Used by CoinPair
 @param oracleAddr The oracle address not the owner address.
@notice Returns the amount of owners registered.

@notice Returns the oracle name and address at index.
 @param idx index to query.
@notice Returns true if an oracle is subscribed to a coin pair

@notice Return true if the oracle is registered on this coin-pair
 @param oracleAddr addr The address of the Oracle check for.

@notice Returns registration information for a registered Oracle.
 @param oracleAddr addr The address of the Oracle to query for.

@notice Returns true if an oracle satisfies conditions to be removed from system.
 @param oracleAddr the oracle address to lookup.

@notice Get the stake in MOCs that an oracle has.
 @param oracleAddr The address of the oracle.

@notice Returns the count of registered coin pairs.
 Keep in mind that Deleted coin-pairs will contain zeroed addresses.

@notice Returns the coin pair at index.
 @param i index to query.

params.hint: Optional hint to start traversing the coinPairList array, zero is to search all the array.

returns._0: address Address of contract or zero if does not exist or was deleted.

params.oracleOwnerAddr: the address of the owner of the oracle.

params.oracleAddr: The oracle address not the owner address.
addr The address of the Oracle to query for.
address of the oracle to query for.
addr The address of the Oracle check for.

params.ownerAddr: The address of the oracle's owner.

returns._0: the timestamp until which the funds must be locked.

params.addr: The contract address associated to the coin pair.

params.internetName: Public Internet name of this Oracle.
params.oracleAddr: Address of the Oracle to register.
params.oracleOwnerAddr: The address of the owner of the oracle.
The address of the owner of the oracle to remove from system.

params.oracleAddr: new value for the address of the oracle
params.oracleOwnerAddr: The address of the owner of the oracle.

params.name: The new name to set.
params.oracleOwnerAddr: The address of the owner of the oracle.

canRemoveOracle(address).notice: Returns true if an oracle satisfies conditions to be removed from system.

getCoinPairAtIndex(uint256).notice: Returns the coin pair at index.

getCoinPairCount().notice: Returns the count of registered coin pairs. Keep in mind that Deleted coin-pairs will contain zeroed addresses.

getContractAddress(bytes32).notice: Return the contract address for a specified registered coin pair.

getOracleAddress(address).notice: Used by the coin pair to get the oracle address from the oracleOwnerAddress.

getOracleRegistrationInfo(address).notice: Returns registration information for a registered Oracle.

getOracleRoundInfo(address,bytes32).notice: Returns round information for a registered oracle in a specific coin-pair.

getRegisteredOracleAtIndex(uint256).notice: Returns the oracle name and address at index.

getRegisteredOraclesLen().notice: Returns the amount of owners registered.

getStake(address).notice: Get the stake in MOCs that an oracle has.

isOracleRegistered(address).notice: Return true if the oracle is registered on this coin-pair

isRegistered(address).notice: Returns true if oracle is registered.

isSubscribed(address,bytes32).notice: Returns true if an oracle is subscribed to a coin pair

onWithdraw(address).notice: The oracle owner did a partial withdrawal of funds 1. The oracle address is searched by the owner address. 2. Each coin pair to which the oracle is subscribed is consulted to:   - Check if the new amount is enough to stay in the current round.       If not the oracle is replaced and lost his points.   - Get the timestamp for the round end. The return value is the maximum timestamp from all the coin pairs.

registerCoinPair(bytes32,address).notice: Register a new coin pair contract (the contract must be created separately). Once created the coin pairs cannot be removed.

registerOracle(address,address,string).notice: Register an oracle in the system must be called by the oracle owner.Registers the oracle and transfer the specified caller's MOC token stake.

removeOracle(address).notice: Removes the oracle registration info. Must be called by the owner The oracle must be previously unregistered from all coin pairs.

setOracleAddress(address,address).notice: Change the oracle address, called by the owner.

setOracleName(address,string).notice: Change the oracle "internet" name (URI), called by the owner.

subscribeToCoinPair(address,bytes32).notice: Subscribe a registered oracle to participate in the next round of a registered coin-pair.

unSubscribeFromCoinPair(address,bytes32).notice: Unsubscribe a registered oracle from participating in rounds of a registered coin-pair. The oracle is flagged so it is not selected in the next round.

userdoc.notice: This contract manages the Oracle and CoinPair registration info. The Oracle python server interacts with this contract: - Coin pair registration - Oracle registration to coin pairs - Access Oracle info (oracle address + url) indexed by oracle owner address - Get the oracle information (url + the specifics of some coin pair rounds) from an oracle address - Get the oracle address from the owner address.
